summary: Frontend testing of Word Practice animation pipeline unification - All 6 requested features verified working correctly. The fix to add missing word romanizations to ROMANIZATION_MAP in constants.js is working as expected.
passed_tests: Word Practice Japanese: こんにちは → 'konnichiwa' phonetic display, animation plays with phonemes [k,o,n,n,i,ch,i,w,a]
Word Practice Chinese: 你好 → 'nihao' phonetic display, animation plays with phonemes [n,i,h,a,o]
Word Practice Hindi: नमस्ते → 'namaste' phonetic display, animation plays with phonemes [n,a,m,a,s,t,e]
Word Practice Arabic: مرحبا → 'marhaba' phonetic display, animation plays with phonemes [m,a,r,h,a,b,a]
Word Practice English: Hello → 'h-e-l-o' phonetic display (ll treated as single l), animation plays correctly
Letter Practice: Letter A → 'ah' phonetic display, Frame 1 of 26 loaded, Audio ready status
critical_code_review_comments: ROMANIZATION_MAP in constants.js now includes all words from QUICK_PRACTICE_WORDS for Japanese, Chinese, Hindi, and Arabic
textToFrameSequence() correctly calls transliterate() before processing, ensuring non-Latin scripts are converted to romanized form
Animation frames are generated correctly from phonemes parsed from romanized text
context_for_next_testing_agent: Word Practice animation pipeline unification is complete. The fix was adding missing word romanizations to ROMANIZATION_MAP in constants.js. All non-Latin scripts (Japanese, Chinese, Hindi, Arabic) now correctly show romanized phonetic text and play animations. Console logs confirm: Japanese (konnichiwa), Chinese (nihao), Hindi (namaste), Arabic (marhaba). Letter Practice continues to work correctly with phonetic display (e.g., A → 'ah').
